p: It can be seen from the experimental data ( Table 2) that the T p of NGO ranges from 201.4 to 218.0 °C, and the Δ H d increases as the β get larger. The Ea of NGO is 166.6 kJ/mol in the range of 163 kJ/mol and 188 kJ/mol [ 39, 40, 41], which is the first-order (O–NO 2 bond fracture) reaction energy of several nitrate energetic materials. This further confirms that the initial thermal decomposition of NGO is the breaking of O–NO 2 bond, and NGO is equivalent to common nitrates in thermal stability and heat release. Compared to the decomposition performance of GO at the heating rate of 10 °C [ 42], the exothermic peak of NGO is 209.7 °C higher than that of GO around in 208.7 °C slightly.
